intro: Emilia pammicrocephala, commonly known as the dwarf emilia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Emilia pammicrocephala is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
